conclusion: To determine if Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the slopes of their velocity-time graphs at that specific time. Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, which is represented by the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Object A's velocity-time graph is represented by the curve labeled 'A.'
Object B's velocity-time graph is represented by the curve labeled 'B.'
Find the point on the horizontal axis (time axis) corresponding to \( t_1 \).

premise: For Object A, draw a tangent to the curve at \( t_1 \) and determine its slope.
conclusion: At \( t_1 \), the slope of the tangent to Object A's curve appears to be negative.

premise: For Object B, draw a tangent to the curve at \( t_1 \) and determine its slope.
conclusion: At \( t_1 \), the slope of the tangent to Object B's curve appears to be positive.

premise: Compare the slopes of the tangents at \( t_1 \) for both objects.
conclusion: Since the slopes of the tangents to the velocity-time graphs of Object A and Object B at \( t_1 \) are different (one is negative and the other is positive), the accelerations of the two objects at \( t_1 \) are not the same.
